title: meet penarth man designed new town parklets
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityJohn Davies, owner ofCandid Creative Studio, worked with the Vale of Glamorgan Council on the parklets after taking part in a competition to design and manage the installation of artwork to celebrate Penarth.In all it took around a month to complete, from the initial conceptualisation meetings through to agreeing the final artwork.ldquoWe carefully balanced the needs for the parklets to have an identity, promote and shout about Penarth, and also appeal to the public at large, he said.Parklets are extensions of trading space built out into existing parking bays that allow businesses to safely accommodate a greater number of customers.D signs of Bridgend fitted the vinyl artwork just in time for outdoor hospitality to open on Monday, April .ldquoIt is Penarthrsquos very own unique and erse architectural heritage which formed the inspiration to the parklets artwork, he added.ldquoThe townrsquos famous landmarks, as well as some lesser known ones, join quirky seaside elements, to decorate the glass .The parklets offer a great opportunity for hospitality businesses to welcome back customers, with some shelter, while they cannot currently open inside.MORE NEWS:lsquoHe will always be in my heartrsquo: Woman raises over pound, in memory of childhood friendPenarth man ordered to repay pound, after selling counterfeit goodsCan you help  Appeal after boombox, toilet and more dumped at Vale parkThe final designed parklets can be seen outside Willmorersquos  on Stanwell Road, and Foxys Deli, Victoria Roadand Gin .ldquoOutside the business opportunities, on a sunny day they also animate Penarthrsquos streets, encourage residents and tourists to stay a little longer in the town and enjoy everything Penarth has he added.ldquoBusinesses and the public alike have enjoyed using the parklets since last week, and feedback on the artwork has been very positive.     For Mr Daviesrsquo graphic design businesses, he says the last few months since the lockdown on December  has lsquoremained steady.rsquoldquoI am very lucky to work with a range of clients ndash the NHS, national charities, ambitious locals, small businesses, and everyone in between ndash who have needed to adapt themselves to the changing landscape caused by the pandemic.ldquoThat ability to stay nimble has allowed my clients to weather the storm so far, and I am faithful that will continue as we see the pandemic in the rear view mirror. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: rnli penarth looking lifeboat station historian
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThe role will see them revealing the stories behind the townrsquos leboat station since it re-opened in , as well as collecting information and statistics on the boats and launches.The volunteer will research and collect oral histories from the many people who have been involved with the station over the years.From past boat crew and family members to the hundreds of volunteers and people throughout the community who have come into contact with the station over the last .RNLI Penarthrsquos first leboat station was built in  for a cost of pound, before being relocated in  when Penarth Esplanade was constructed.The station closed in , and the town had no leboat station for another  years. Not until the increasing popularity of Penarth as a destination for tourism and leisure boating saw the need for leboat services to be re-established in .MORE NEWS:#The current purpose-built station was constructed in .The history of the th century station has been well-documented, but not its history since , which is what this new role will uncover.Laurie Pavelin, chair of RNLI Penarth Leboat Station, said: ldquoPenarthrsquos leboat station has been a central part of the community since , and in that time it has played a part in many peoplersquos lives.ldquoThe people of Penarth have volunteered, fundraised, attended events, brought safety lessons to schools, and played a part in RNLIrsquos lesaving work in so many dferent ways.ldquoWersquore looking forward to welcoming a new volunteer historian who will make sure those stories are preserved for the community. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: senedd election  vaughan gething retains seat

When we saw the boxes being opened in Penarth we also saw there was a very strong showing there."It was hard to tell how all of the votes scattered amongst the fringe parties, but in the main parties it was clear that we were going to have a good result."When asked about what is in store for next term, he said: "Well we need to see what the national results are, and Ive still got choices to make as the health minister until a new government is formed."Some of those are still big and dficult, and I think its part of the reason why people renwed their faith in us and that is because they recognise there are still challenges to navigate our way through."But I really do look forward to within tis next term being able to see people in a more normal way - to go to more community events and have more of the person to person contact weve all missed in this last year and more."This year saw a sizeable increase in voter turnout with , votes cast- . per cent - compared to . per cent in .The full results for Cardf South and Penarth are as follows:Vaughan Gething- ,Leighton Rowlands- ,Nasir Adam- ,Helen Westhead- ,Alex Wilson- ,Paul Campbell- Lisa Peregrine- Matt Friend- Alan Pick- Alan Golding- David Rolfe- Angus Hawkins-  article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. Senedd for the South Wales Central seat at the Senedd election count at Memo Arts Centre in Barry.lt spangtlt spangtlt spangt" Watch: Senedd Election : Meet the new MSs for South Wales CentralAndrew RT Davies" Skip to next photo Show caption  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl" href" my account emailthispage " s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentBOTH the Conservative and Plaid Cymru won two seats in the South Wales Central region.Rhys ap Owen and Heledd Fychan were elected for Plaid, with Welsh Conservative leader Andrew RT Davies retaining his seat in the region, along with Joel James.Neither Mr Davies nor Mr Jones attended the count at the Barry Memo Arts Centre today, despite the Welsh Conservatives securingtheir best ever Senedd result ndash winning  seats.On the partys overall result, Mr Davies said: ldquoFirstly, Irsquod like to say a huge thank you to our outstanding set of Welsh Conservative candidates, activists and staff whorsquove worked incredibly hard throughout this campaign and secured the partys best ever Senedd result.ldquoThe team has gone above and beyond and deserve great credit for the positive campaign wersquove run right across Wales, and I am thrilled to see Natasha Asghar make history in South Wales East by becoming the first female from a BAME background to be elected to the Senedd.ldquoAs a party we are also delighted to have secured constituency seats in the Vale of Clwyd and Brecon and Radnorshire, and increased seats on the regional lists, resulting in our highest ever representation in the Senedd with  members.ldquoItrsquos been an unconventional campaign and itrsquos clear incumbency and continuity has played a signicant part. To that end, I would like to offer my sincere congratulations to Mark Drakeford and Welsh Labour on a successful campaign.ldquoThe election has been fought in good spirit by political parties in Wales and I would like to pay a final word of thanks to the many officials across the country whorsquove allowed this election to take place in a safe and effective manner.Plaid Cymru gained an extra seat this election, which was occupied by Ukip in , secured  seats in the Senedd in total and meant Labour fell short of a majority in Wales.Speaking on the win, Heledd Fychan of Plaid Cymru said she feels ldquoincredibly honoured, humbled and excited and that there will be a lot of ldquoreading and preparing in the coming days.     Spoke with @heleddfychan after Plaid secured two seats at the South Wales Central counts #SeneddVote pic GKeJwmdash BrookeMay , ldquoI know the first thing that I want to focus on in the Senedd is fighting for independent inquiry into the  floods that devastated communities from the Vale of Glamorgan right to the Cynon Valley.ldquoSo thatrsquos definitely one of my first priorities.ldquoGiven that we werenrsquot able to campaign until April  or knock any doors Irsquom extremely proud that wersquove achieved an increase in number of members we have in the Senedd.Heledd Fychan of Plaid Cymru after being elected to the Senedd for the South Wales Central seat at the Senedd election count at Memo Arts Centre in Barry. Picture: Huw Evans Picture AgencyldquoPersonally in Pontypridd we raised the vote by four percent, which I was incredibly proud of and I think the fact that we have so many new, fresh faces coming to the Senedd means that there is a lot of excitement about what we will be able to achieve as a group.Mr ap Owen added: "Its sinking in now slowly. It always looked likely that we were going to get regional seats here in South Wales Central but we dont quite believe it until it actually happens."Rhys ap Owen of Plaid Cymru after being elected to the Senedd for the South Wales Central seat at the Senedd election count at Memo Arts Centre in Barry. Picture: Huw Evans Picture AgencyHe says that campaigning during the coronavirus pandemic has been "dficult" and "unusual.""Usually we would be knocking doors for well over a year before an election and we havent been able to do that so it has been a very dferent election to any I have experienced."The full results are below:Welsh Labour ndash ,Welsh Conservatives ndash ,Plaid Cymru - ,Wales Green Party ndash ,Welsh Liberal Democrats ndash ,Abolish the Welsh Assembly Party - ,Propel - ,Ukip - Scrap the Assembly Senedd ndash ,Reform UK - ,No More Lockdowns - ,Gwlad - The Welsh Independence Party - ,Britains Communist Party - Alan Coulthard ndash Trade Unionist and Socialist Coalition - Workers Party ndash  article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: labours alun michael re elected south wales pcc
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityAlun Michael" Labours Alun Michael re-elected as South Wales PCC for third timeAlun Edward Michael" Skip to next photo Show caption  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl" href" my account emailthispage " s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentALUN Michael has been re-elected as the Police and Crime Commissioner for South Wales.The Welsh Labour politician has been serving as the PCC since the role was created in , and will continue to do so for another four years after winning  per cent of the total vote.Conservative candidate Steve Gallagher came in second with  per cent.Among first preference votes, Mr Michael received , ndash or . percent ndash falling short of the  per cent needed to win re-election.Alun Michael speaking after his winOnce the top two were confirmed, the second preference votes were counted ndash those whose first choice was eliminated ndash which saw Mr Michael elected with , votes, and Steve Gallagher had ,.Speaking on his win, Mr Michael said: ldquoItrsquos been a very strange election, coming as it does in the period of Covid-.ldquoSo my first thanks are to the other candidates who have shown stamina through that period.MORE NEWS:ldquoWe took part in a number of speech debates and they were constructed exchanges about things that matter to the electorate of South Wales.ldquoThank you to all the staff who have been involved in the count, including the police officers who have been here to deal with any outbreaks but fortunately they havenrsquot had to deal with.ldquoYou have all shown incredible stamina throughout the last few days with the challenges of the count in this period of Covid-.ldquoAnd thank you in particular to the electorate of South Wales across the  constituencies. I take very seriously indeed the responsibilities the votes cast today place on my shoulders in trying to deliver and to continue to improve the effectiveness of policing.ldquoMy commitment is to do that with renewed energy.     The job of a PCC is to oversee how crime is tackled in their area. They hold their forces to account and set local force priorities and budgets. They also scrutinise the chief constable with the power to appoint and dismiss them.They also work with local partners to prevent crime. The hope is that their democratic mandate from the public makes them more accountable and able to respond to local peoplersquos concerns.First preference votes:Second preference votes:Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: can say penarth e bike expansion
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityWhen the fleet of  e-bikes and five stations was launched in November last year thanks to funding from The Vale of Glamorgan Council, it became the first public electric bike share scheme in Wales.Now thanks to its success, funding has been made available to expand the scheme into Dinas Powys.An online public consultation is being launched by nextbike today , where people can say where they would like to see a station installed and why.Nextbike UK MD, Krysia Solheeim, said: ldquoThe scheme has proved incredibly popular to date, with more than , journeys made and , km cycled so far."Thanks to its success, we want to expand the station network to allow convenient access to even more people.ldquoBike share schemes can have such a positive impact on peoplersquos lives in many ways, from the physical and mental health benefits that cycling brings, to the reduction in congestion and CO emissions that comes from cycling instead of using motorised transport.MORE NEWS:ldquoWersquore really keen to hear from the public about where they would like to see the new stations situated. Our bike share schemes are there to benefit the whole community, which is why we want to hear from as many people as possible.Nextbike docking stations have to be close to popular destinations such as existing transport links, job centres, supermarkets and other shops be in an area of high footfall be highly visible and easy to find have enough space to allow safe movement of pedestrians and people with limited mobility and be accessible by van or bike trailer to allow the nextbike service team to maintain the bikes and stations.     Final decisions will be made based on the above criteria, in addition to the ability to get power to the locations, which is determined by power providers.Councillor Peter King, Cabinet Member for Neighbourhood Services and Transport Vale of Glamorgan Council, said: ldquoThe nextbike e-bike hire scheme in Penarth has proved extremely successful."Since its launch, the hire of the bikes has been steadily increasing.ldquoWith the onset of summer, we have implemented a new docking station at Cosmeston, and very soon there will be a new docking station in Sully."I am convinced the scheme will only go from strength to strength.ldquoTwo additional docking stations in Dinas Powys will complement the existing nextbike network within the Vale of Glamorgan and provide an additional sustainable transport link between these three areas."I would encourage Dinas Powys residents to respond to the consultation as itrsquos important they are located where they are accessible to as many people as possible.Penarthrsquos existing stations are located at the Esplanade, Llandough Hospital, Windsor Road, Penarth Train Station, the Barrage and the recently-installed Cosmeston.While the Penarth bikes can currently only be rented and ed to Penarth stations, the ambition is to eventually link the scheme to nextbikersquos Cardf fleet, meaning commuters will be able to use the e-bikes to make the journey between the town and the city with ease.E-bikes are a combination of a conventional bike with a motor that take some of the effort out of pedalling for the rider. With top speeds of km per hour, the e-bikes can cover greater distances in less time and with less effort than conventional cycles.E-bike rental costs pound per  minutes for customers with a monthly or annual membership, or pound per  minutes on a pay as you ride basis.The consultation runs until May . To take part, visitwww.nextbike en dinas-powysor get in touch with suggestions on social media via @nextbikeUK. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: wales send hundreds ventilators india
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThe Welsh Government and NHS Wales are providing around  oxygen concentrators and more than  ventilators which are due to leave for India in the coming days.Health minister Vaughan Gething said: ldquoCovid- is a global threat and as such it is right that we are part of the global response, supporting other nations.ldquoWe have worked closely with the UK Government and the Government of India on the logistics in arranging for these supplies to be transported to India and distributed to the hospitals where they are needed most.Mr Gething and chairman of Waless branch of the British Association of Physicians of Indian OriginProfessor Keshav Singhal visited the NHS Wales National Distribution Centre on Monday, May , to inspect the supplies.MORE NEWS:Flights are being arranged by the Foreign Commonwealth and Development Office. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: hundreds thousands spent two roads vale now wont get built
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityFor several years Vale of Glamorgan council was drawing up plans to build a road from the A to the M, and another road bypassing Dinas Powys.But last month the Welsh Government announced it would not fund building these new roads, as part of its new transport strategy which focuses on public and active transport.Now the Vale council has revealed the total cost spent on these two roads which have now been cancelled: pound,.More NewsLabours Alun Michael re-elected as South Wales PCCDisruption on train lines between Wales and London todayLook whorsquos just been in court from Barry and St AthanThe costs include hiring consultants to draw up plans for where the roads would potentially go, as well as y public consultation to seethere were support for them.The road from the A at Sycamore Cross to the M at Junction  proved highly unpopular as concerns ranged from houses getting knocked down to ancient woodland felled.That road has cost pound,, which was funded by grants from the Welsh Government.The road bypassing Dinas Powys however was generally supported by the public, and was part of a wider project to improve transport infrastructure in the village like better bus shelters and cycling routes. The bypass could have cut congestion in Dinas too, a current problem.The wider Dinas transport project has cost pound,, mostly from Welsh Government, but including pound, from the Vale council.Councillor Peter King, cabinet member for transport, said: ldquoWelsh Government is moving very much away from road building into tackling climate change, which I really find some dficulty objecting to.ldquoIt has always frustrated me that the work was seen as the Dinas Powys bypass. But it wasnrsquot mdash it was the Dinas Powys transport infrastructure, because it included all sorts of things, including cycle networks and better access to train stations.     He revealed the costs during a meeting of the full council on Monday, April , after a question from Cllr Ian Johnson, leader of the Plaid Cymru group on the Vale.However some of the wider works to improve transport around Dinas could still be funded where, like from the Cardf Capital Region, a body of  councils across south-east Wales. One project that could go ahead includes a cycle route from Newport to Barry.Cllr King said: ldquoWe think we can probably pursue some of [wider work] through the city region, and we have also been awarded money for the active travel Newport to Barry route. So some of the other elements of the transport infrastructure we can pursue.ldquoBut wersquoll wait until after the election [on May ] to see whorsquos in charge, before we decide what to do next. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: laurence llewelyn bowen joins campaign transform plas llanmihangel
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityOne of the finest and most complete early gentry houses in the Vale of Glamorgan, Plas Llanmihangel is currently on the market for pound. million. Rather than see it go into private occupancy, Connect to Purpose aims to purchase and restore the Grade  listed fortiedmanor house, and turn it into a safe and tranquil retreat fordisadvantaged young people and their families from across South Wales.Help and support offered to families will include personal development coaching, health and wellbeing therapies, education and creative arts , as well as opportunities to commune with nature in the surrounding countryside and play their part in the conservation of the manor.Plas Llanmihangel. Picture: Trip AdvisorThecharity also intends to share the unique historic home with the wider community, byoffering bed and breakfast, and holiday rental accommodation for public use delivering wellbeing retreats and open days, and holding an annual medieval festival of arts.MORE NEWS:Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen, said: "I was lucky enough to fall in love with Plas Llanmihangel over a decade ago, filming its fairytale gothic glory for the BBC series lsquoHidden Houses of Walesrsquo."What struck me then, and gives me so much pleasure now, is the fact that this building is such a powerful time capsule, with the ability to take visitors back to so many dferent, extremely important, moments that defined the history of Wales and indeed the history of the UK."With this in mind I am compelled to support this extraordinarily exciting initiative to revivy one of my favourite Welsh buildings and use it to help young people learn the skills they need to create the kind of le for themselves that they desire.     In order to purchase Plas Llanmihangel, the charity has launched acrowdfunding page.Trustee of Connect to Purpose, Georgina Saralis, said: ldquoOur aim is to save and sympathetically restore this spectacular property and create a comfortable family home to be shared with the local community and visitors alike."Through a programme of education, therapy, creative arts and coaching, we will offer disadvantaged young people and their families the support, time and space needed to find a way through their dficulties.To find out more about the project, visitwww.plasllanmihangel. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. The post is usually held for a year. It is a separate position from the council leader.The annual general meeting of the council was the first to be broadcast live online since the start of the coronavirus pandemic.The council had previously been uploading recordings of public meetings days after they were held, but faced criticism for the delays.MORE NEWS:The mayor was nominated for re-election by her party colleague Cllr Gwyn John, who said: ldquoCllr Jayne Norman has been on this council since ."She has worked very hard over the last year and previous years as a councillor.ldquoBut last year in her role as mayor, it has been extremely dficult for her and wersquore absolutely delighted to nominate her to continue her role as mayor."Irsquom sure Cllr Norman this year will be able to carry out her duties to excellence.On being re-elected, she said: ldquoThank you to all for my appointment. I hope this year will see us get back to as close as possible to normal.Cllr Rhiannon Birch was also elected as deputy mayor. title: penarth rfc pay tribute lovely human being
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityBorn in Penarth in , Stu, one of the four sons of local man Len Davies, went to St Joseph School, where he started playing rugby, together with the current club president John Davey.After school, he joined the Royal Navy, where he spent his entire rugby playing career aboard HMS Bulwark, HMS Raleigh, HMS Devonshire and HMS Centaur, the later as captain of the first XV.He ed to civilian le in , when he joined the marine department of Cardf Port Authority as operations manager.During his time with the Port Authority he met again his old school friend John Davey, at the time the supervisor of the Port Cargo operations and also the secretary of Penarth RFC.John talked his old school friend into joining the Penarth RFC club committee, taking over as kit manager, a position he retained for the following  years, before the outbreak of the coronavirus epidemic.In due course, Stu Davies became the clubrsquos main statistician, having managed to compile the post-war club database, which is now widely used by the club.ldquoWithout his extraordinary comprehensive and accurate work, the volume The Spirit of Penarth would have never been published, said author and former club secretary Chris Thau.Former Penarth RFC chairman Mike Gooding has described Stu as one of the kindest and most considerate men he had the privilege to deal with in his entire playing and administrative career with the seaside club.He said: ldquoI cannot imagine the club without him, somewhere in the background, with his little notebook keeping track of scores and scorers."Stuart was a proper gentlemen and I have not met anybody who could say a bad word about him."He was a lovely human being, full of compassion and humanity. He was just one of a kind and will be sorely missed.     Stuart was a good family man. He married Janet, a NHS nurse, and they had a wonderful daughter Rhinna, whom he absolutely adored.Sadly, during the last couple of years his health had deteriorated, though he made brave efforts to carry on trying to help the struggling rugby club. At the end of October he had a stroke while driving his car and ended up in hospital, where the Covid- lockdown prevented him from seeing his family for several months, which left him very upset and both Janet and Rhinna heartbroken. ldquoHe lost ten stones in weight and seemed to have aged  years in  days, explained his daughter.Thankfully, he was determined to see his loved ones and say goodbye, as Rhinna explained, so he resolutely battled against the odds, making sure he was able to see them by the end of April when the lockdown was relaxed.ldquoHe has waited for us," said Rhinna. "We went to see him and mum said that he was waiting for us and his brother Keith to say goodbye.There is very little doubt Penarth RFC will never be the same without Stu Davies. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: coronavirus one three adults wales fully vaccinated
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityAs of Tuesday,  per cent of Welsh adults have now received their first dose of the vaccinewhile , second doses have also been administered."I am extremely grateful to all our NHS colleagues and all the volunteers across Wales whose continuous hard work and dedication is making our excellent progress through our COVID- vaccination programme possible," said health minister Vaughan Gething."Soon we will have given two million first doses and one million second doses, which is truly phenomenal progress in our fight against Covid-.":Earlier this week, the Joint Committee on Vaccination and Immunisationsaid, as a precautionary measure, people under  with no clinical risk factors who are not yet vaccinated, should be offered an alternate to Oxford AstraZeneca vaccine."We have immediately implemented this change into our programme," said Mr Gething."The appropriate vaccine will be made available at peoplersquos appointments."We do not envisage that this will lead to a delay to the roll out of our vaccine programme in Wales. We are continuing to work towards the third milestone set out in our strategy, which is to offer a vaccine to everyone aged  and over by July ."As we have regularly statedvaccine supply allows us to move faster than we will do so."Everybody who has already had a first dose of the AstraZeneca vaccine should be reassured that they should receive a second dose of the same brand, irrespective of age, in line with JCVI advice. Medical exemptions may apply to a very small minority."The AstraZeneca vaccine has already saved thousands of lives and remains safe and effective for the majority of the population. Over .million people have received the AstraZeneca vaccine in Wales since January, with very few cases of the rare clotting with thrombocytopenia event."     What to doyou havent had your appointmentPeople in the Aneurin Bevan University Health Board region who have not yet received their vaccination appointment have been encouraged to contact the health board.If you received a first dose of Pfizer vaccine between December  and the end of February but have not received notication of second dose, you should complete the form at abuhb.nhs.wales coronavirus covid--vaccineFor people who had an AstraZeneca first dose between January  and February  but not received notication of second dose, they should also complete a form at the website above.If you are aged  and above and have not received your Covid- vaccination appointment, visit the aged  and above section of the vaccine page on the health board website.If you are clinically extremely vulnerable or have underlying health conditions that would classy you as priority group  or  under the JCVI guidance, contact your GP practiceyou have not received a vaccination invitation. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: sully home seven bedrooms amazing al fresco entertaining area

It also has an en suite bathroom fitted with a contemporary white suite including a double ended bath and fully tiled walk in shower cubicle.The family bathroom is ft by ft and has a modern white suite including a bath with spa jets and large glazed shower cubicle.On the second floor you will find adaptable accommodation which could form a flat or provide independent living for older children living at home.The central sitting room is ft by ft and has low doors to eaves cupboards.There are two bedrooms on this floor along with a study area and a bathroom with a double ended bath and a walk in shower cubicle with glazed entry door, frosted double glazed window and recessed lighting.At the front of the property there is a U-shape, tarmac in  out drive providing parking for several cars.To the rear is a very private, wide high-quality paved sitting area with floor lighting which extends into a covered outdoor kitchen, built-in barbecue and sink, lighting, heating and sound system with enclosed store room off.     More NewsBarry ramblers walk the Skirrid in MonmouthshireCardf and Vale College apprentice crowned the best in the UKMayor of Vale of Glamorgan re-elected for second termTo the side of the house is an exceptionally private Astro turfed play area enclosed by ft high fencing with access to a substantial detached outbuilding ided into two parts providing a useful general store with deep shelving and a separate home office.This property is on the market with Herbert R Thomas, Cowbridge. For more details contact  .Hours or services may dfer during this time. title: fossilised tracks suggest earliest known evidence mammals sea
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThe findings suggest mammals may have first used marine habitats at least . million years earlier than previously thought, in the late Paleocene , rather than the Eocene .Researchers examined and photographed more than , metres of fossilised footprints recently discovered within the Hanna Formation in Wyoming, US, in an area dated back to  million years ago by plant and pollen fossils.They identied ious dferent tracks, including one set that showed relatively large, five-toed footprints, comparable to the foot size of a modern-day brown bear, while another showed medium-sized, four-toed footprints.The authors suggest the five-toed prints were made by Coryphodon, a type of semiaquatic Pantodont, similar to a hippopotamus.While the four-toed prints did not match skeletal evidence of mammals known from the late Paleocene, they show similarities with artiodactyls and tapiroids, which have yet to be shown to have existed in the Paleocene.Geologist Anton Wroblewski, an adjunct associate professor at the University of Utah, and applied bioersity scientist Bonnie Gulas-Wroblewski of the Texas AM Natural Resources Institute, reported their findings in Scientic Reports.Prof Wroblewski said: ldquoTrace fossils like footprints record interactions between organisms and their environments, providing information that body fossils alone cannot.ldquoIn this case, trace fossils show that large-bodied mammals were regularly using marine environments only eight million years after non-avian dinosaurs went extinct.ldquoPaleontologists have been working in this area for thirty years, but theyrsquove been looking for bones, leaf fossils and pollen, so they didnrsquot notice footprints or trackways.He first saw the tracks in September .     Prof Wroblewski said: ldquoWhen I found them, it was late afternoon and the setting sun hit them at just the right angle to make them visible on the tilted slabs of sandstone.ldquoAt first, I couldnrsquot believe what I was seeing. I had walked by this outcrop for years without noticing them.ldquoOnce I saw the first few, I followed out the ridge of sandstone and realised they were part of a much larger, more extensive trackway..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: Fossilised tracks suggest earliest known evidence of mammals at the sea article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: e fit woman released newborn baby found park
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThe baby, who was named George by those looking after him in hospital, was discovered clothed and wrapped in a blanket by a dog walker at The Mounds in Kings Norton, Birmingham, at .pm on April .The youngster, believed to be full-term, is thought to have been only hours old when found and is healthy and doing well with his foster carers. vw,vw,px, px"The baby boy was named George by hospital staff West Midlands Police said they have been searching for Georgersquos mother for exactly three weeks.The force said the image has been created by a specialist at Thames Valley Police after speaking to a key witness.Police are urging anyone who knows who it is, or the woman herself, to get in touch with them.The force said they are still ldquodesperately concerned about Georgersquos mother and want to check she is doing OK, both physically and mentally.ldquoThis remains our only concern right now, so wersquod like to reassure her as well as her family and friends of this, the force said.Detective Inspector Neil Hunt, who is leading the investigation, added: ldquoOnce again, I really want to reach out to Georgersquos mother as you are my concern.ldquoIrsquom worried about you and I need to make sure you are safe and well.ldquoWersquove not taken the decision to issue this image lightly or to frighten you. We simply want to find you so we can talk to you, check you are okay, and offer any help or support you may need.ldquoIf anyone recognises this woman, or thinks they know who Georgersquos mother is, please do get in touch. You can do so in complete confidenceyoursquod prefer.ldquoWersquove had a good response to our earlier appeals and I thank everyone who has contact us so far.ldquoIf you know anything minus no matter how small or insignicant it may seem minus please get in touch.The woman has been described as white, around ft ins tall and of medium large build.     She was wearing a light grey zipped hoodie and jogging bottoms, and her hair may have been in a low ponytail at the time.Police are handing out leaflets which include the image in the local area, encouraging anyone who recognises the woman or anyone who knows anything to contact them.Anyone with information is urged to contact police via live chat on their website or call , quoting log  of  April.People can stay anonymous by calling Crimestoppers on   ..push,i[r].l*new Dateas,ms[]a.asynca.srcgmgagagagagagagagagagaga, title: E-fit of woman released after newborn baby found in park article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"Comments are closed on this article. -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: tesco launches new summer food collection for struggling families and children
story: Family and police ‘increasingly concerned’ for man missing since Sunday   Council gives the go ahead to big plans for TandrageeNewsTraffic and TravelCrimeWeatherPoliticsBusinessEducationHealthPeopleRead ThisCoronavirusSportFootballOther SportWhats OnArts and EntertainmentThings To DoHomes and GardensLestyleCarsHomes and GardensPublic NoticesAdvertise My BusinessNewsPeopleTesco launches new Summer Food Collection for struggling families and childrenTesco’s in Portadown is to hold an extra summer Food Collection for children and families.By Carmel RobinsonThursday, th May , : pm  "       "  This is a UK-wide initiative to support local families this summer.During the collection, which will take place in large Tesco stores from July  to  and in Express stores from July  to August , customers will be urged to donate long-le food to the Trussell Trust and FareShare to help them in their vital work to support families in communities across the UK. Tesco will again be topping up all customer donations with a % cash donation to the two charities.]]Donations are made at the launch of the Tesco Food Collection.Tesco UK  NI CEO Jason Tarry said: “Both the Trussell Trust and FareShare face extra demands during the summer, when children who would normally enjoy a healthy meal in school may miss out. That is why we have decided to hold this extra collection.”Charities FareShare and the Trussell Trust have welcomed the announcement.Emma Revie, Chief Executive of the Trussell Trust, added: “No one should face the indignity of needing emergency food. “Yet in the last year, food banks in our network provided record numbers of emergency food parcels to people struggling to afford the essentials. “This is not right but we know we can build a better future. “Thanks to the incredible ongoing generosity of Tesco, we are thrilled that customers will be able to support food banks during the Summer Food Collection. “Every donation makes such a dference and helps food banks in our network provide the best possible emergency support while we work together towards building a hunger free future,” said Emma.Spot checks on pupils as NI principal reveals Snapchat used to get ‘zombie’ drug Spice Read full story here--Editor’s Message:Thank you for reading this article. title: omagh mum fundraiser raises close to k in  hours
story: AN Omagh mother-of-three who has been diagnosed with terminal cancer has almost doubled her fundraising target of pound, to fly to Mexico for alternative treatment. Jemma McGowan, , was given the nightmare news that her chemotherapy would be stopped after medics found new tumours in her pelvic area and pubic bone on Monday. After researching alternative therapy to try and prolong her le, she is planning to travel to Mexico - but she needs at least pound, to do so. On Thursday morning, over pound, had been raised on her Go Fund Me page. In an update, Jemma said: My husband Clive and I have been just so overwhelmed by the generosity of family and friends and the whole community over the past few days. It really has brought a sense of hope back to me since I got my scan results on Monday, to have not only achieved my target figure but surpassed it by an insane amount - my miracle. I have received thousands of messages from people that are in similar situations, people that have battled and are winning as well as family members of the unlucky victims of this indiscriminate disease. I want to take this opportunity to thank everyone that has donated, shared my story and prayed for me and my family, I am truly blessed to have had this unimaginable support in such a short period of time. Hopefully in the next few days I will know a timeframe of the next stage of my journey.
